element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm calculates semivariances from a raster layer, calculating the mean of all semivariances in each interval.
Vertical and horizontal semivariances are calculated, analyzing cells from each cell in the input layer, in vertical and horizontal direction up to a maximum given distance.

element.name: LAYER
element.text: Layer with the variable to be studied.

element.name: MAXDIST
element.text: Maximum distance to calculate semivariances (in number of cells). The larger this number, the longer it takes to run this algorithm, since the number of intervals to calculate is larger.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: New table with three fields: distance, horizontal semivariance, vertical semivariance
